research gone into learning preferences this is the Felder Silverman model from
1988 and I'm sure there are other models but this is one that I use when I'm teaching because it fits so well to me
and um what he's saying is that we have global and sequential
Learners and it is of course aign from Global to sequential learner so you can
also be in the middle and be a little bit of both but but the difference between a global and a sequential
learner is that a global learner likes to see the big picture and can actually with very
little detailed information suddenly understand a lot of very abstract things on a very high
level on the other hand If This Global preference person or Apprentice gets a
lot of small details it will confuse them and it'll take a lot of time until
they get the big picture and only when they get the big picture they will be able to take all the details and put
them in the right places in their head on the other hand if you're a sequential learner what you need is the small
details because if you start giving them the big picture then they wouldn't know
how to look at this big picture they need the details then they need the little code Snippets in able to
